snippet: Ukrainian military and police forces resumed their effort to retake Slovyansk, and violence erupted in port city of Odessa on the Black Sea.
abstract: Ukrainian military and police forces resume their effort to retake rebel-controlled city of Slovyansk, two days after country's interim government declared itself all but helpless to control events in the east; violence between pro-Ukrainian and pro-Russian protesters also erupts in previously calmer port city of Odessa.

byline.original: By C. J. CHIVERS and NOAH SNEIDER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Neil MacFarquhar and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow, Alan Cowell from London, Alison Smale from Kiev, Ukraine, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Ukrainian military and police forces resumed their effort to retake Slovyansk, and violence erupted in port city of Odessa on the Black Sea.

headline.main: Ukrainians Strike Rebel-Held City as Fighting Spreads
headline.print_headline: Ukrainian Troops Strike Rebel-Held City as Fighting Spreads to Black Sea Port
